Reviews.Title: “Smaller than average room”
Reviews.Author: Cawowyn
Reviews.Content: This is a very pretty property, well maintained, friendly staff and conveniently located. But if you are looking for large rooms this is not the place for you. The room had two queen beds, desk area and closet built into the wall, flat screen TV, microwave, small refrigerator and reading chair. The bathroom is compact. Everything is there you would expect from a Hampton property except the size of the room. For two, maybe three, people it is fine. Would I stay there again? Absolutely! This hotel is within walking distance of speedway and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding stay!”
Reviews.Author: Lora V
Reviews.Content: Our stay for the Coke Zero 400 Race Weekend was outstanding due to the awesome staff at The Hampton Inn! From the moment we arrived to check in we were greeted warmly by Lauren, the Sales Mgr. Although our room was not quite ready (we had arrived early) she offered to call as soon as it was available. The Manager, Steve was equally friendly & accommodating with our parking request. We were checked in by Kerri at the Front Desk who was cheerful and informative. Once in our we requested a refrigerator and were informed they would check to see if there were any extras available. Within 15 minutes we had one delivered to our room! They set up a portable bar in the Lobby for Happy Hour both Friday & Saturday where we met Jason, the General Manager who kept us happy with an assortment of libations! Staff member Jessy kept the Hampton Inn common areas clean and well maintained. Everyone was so nice and contributed to the recipe for us having a fantastic time! We look forward to returning next year for a repeat performance.....with a different Coke Zero race winner...lol!

Reviews.Title: “VERY SMALL ROOM - NOT UP TO HAMPTON STANDARDS”
Reviews.Author: SweetFlGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton Inn Daytona Speedway for a conference. Although we were checked in immediately upon arrival we noticed many other guests having to wait because their rooms were not yet clean. This was at 4:00 in the afternoon. You would think that by that time housekeeping would be long done. Our room was TINY. You could barely walk through it. There was simply no room. Everything in the room (two double beds which they claimed were "queen", a table, and another small vanity which the coffee pot sat on) were all crammed into the room. The bathroom was laso very small. There was barely room to close the door. To top it off - this room was out of date. Old CRT-TV. When we saw the size of the room we went back to the front desk, told the clerk we had ordered 2 QUEEN beds and had FIVE people in the room. We thought there would be room for my daughter to have her sleeping bag on the floor. Well, the clerk promptly told us these WERE Queen size beds (by whose standards I'll never know). He said the only thing he could have done was upgrade us to a suite but the one they had was occupied. The pool was small (no surprise) and the building seemed to be situated around it. It was in a corner. Amazingly, the hotel has a spa tub that is so deep that an adult can not sit down in it with out the water touching their chin. This was the only surprise. On the good side, the room was clean (although Housekeeping could have refilled the tolit paper which ran out in the middle of the night), the lobby area was nicely decorated, and the hot breakfast was plentiful with good coffee and very helpful breakfast staff. They charged $92 with tax. This place is not worth that rate. If you're only staying for a night and not expecting quality then this is o.k., but if (like us) you're frequent Hilton Honors Hotel guests this is not hte place for you. This place does not live up to hampton Inn standards.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible room, bad service, corporate unhelpful”
Reviews.Author: worthyking
Reviews.Content: They screwed up our reservation and put us in a double instead of king room, then switched us to a disgusting old king room in the elevator lobby...literally in the tiled lobby area where the elevators are. If we opened our room door we were staring at the elevator doors. The hum and constant ding ding all night made for a bad night's sleep. The room looked like it was decorated in the early eighties and had stains on the walls. I called the front desk (Shane) to inform him of our displeasure and he was rude and very unhelpful. When I pointed out the satisfaction guarantee printed on the room key his response was, quote: "if you stay, you pay". Meaning we would have to leave and go somewhere else in order to take advantage of their "satisfaction guarantee". After arguing with him for a few minutes he finally promised to talk to the General manager and get back to me with a solution. He never did. And studiously ignored us whenever we walked by the front desk. After the weekend I called Hilton corporate to file a complaint and invoke the Hampton Satisfaction Guarantee, which (quoted from their website) says: "Our friendly service and free amenities are all backed by our 100% Hampton Guarantee™. If you're not 100% satisfied, we don't expect you to pay. That's our promise and your guarantee. That's 100% Hampton.™". Well, that was a joke. They took my complaint and promised that the GM from the property would contact me within three days to resolve it. He never did. A week later I called corporate again and they apologized for all the trouble and offered me 2500 Hilton Honors points to make up for my trouble. Really?? I said no. I told them I wished to invoke the satisfaction guarantee. She said they don't guarantee room types. What a joke. After arguing with her for 20 minutes and another 10 on hold she finally said they would refund one night but not both. Unbelievable!! So, if you decide to try this hotel, here's my advice: 1. Book in advance and DEMAND a newly renovated room ONLY. 2. Don't deal with Shane at the front desk if you have any problems. 3. Don't leave messages or expect a call back on any issues you have. Be prepared to traipse down to the front desk and demand what you need. 4. Don't expect them or Hilton corporate to honor their written guarantee. Your "satisfaction" is not what their guarantee is about. It is simply a marketing ploy which they seem to honor grudgingly, only partially, and only after a lengthy argument. All in all a very unpleasant experience with Hampton and Hilton in general. We race at Daytona 3-4 times a year (as well as another 10+ weekends a year in other cities), travel with our team and crew and generally book 4-10 rooms at any property we stay, and as of this bit of unpleasantness we shall carefully avoid all Hilton owned properties in the future. I hope it was worth it to Hilton for that $88 of mine they got to keep.

Reviews.Title: “Location was great”
Reviews.Author: opichardo
Reviews.Content: Great location for bike week. Right across from vendors at the speedway. Also close to lots of restaurants. Plenty of parking, felt safe. Breakfast was included but I did not like it, so ate elsewhere. Towels were an issue, we had towait for them to wash towels so we could shower twice while there for 4 days. Staff was courteous.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: perri o
Reviews.Content: my husband had surgery at halifax in daytona beach so when he was ready to be released from the hospital the surgeon wanted us to stay close by for a week this is the hotel that was recommended to me it is close to the hospital but also close to the speedway the airport and the mall everyone here has been great from the desk clerks to housekeeping they have called to check on us and see if we needed anything helped us find places the room is very nice and comfortable it has a fridge and microwave in the room a large bath and free internet. an out door pool the free breakfast has been wonderful every morning is something different we have had eggs, biscuits, gravy, oats, cereal, waffles, french toast sticks, fruit, all we tried was very good and they have a breakfast to go when you are heading out the door already bagged up for you to take with you to eat if you don't have time to eat here they have a beverage center all the time with coffee, tea, hot chocolate overall everything was very nice but the people here made it great

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: DrAlias
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during Bike Week which was pure madness. But the hotel staff was friendly and informative. The rooms were clean, but thought there were refrigerators and microwaves in each room, which turned out not to be true. Those rooms have to be requested. The free breakfast was good but not prepared for the crowd, therefore they ran out of breakfast. The rooms are clean, staff very friendly and the location was in the middle of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location off of I95, Located next to daytona speedway”
Reviews.Author: cruzn2kw
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night at this location. Hotel is located next to Daytona Speedway. We got a double room for $107. Room(307) was newly renovated, very clean. It was small compared to other hampton locations.I would compare the size to that of a Cruise ship balcony room. bathrom was small as well. Staff was very friendly. Breakfast was good, i enjoyed the hot oatmeal. coffee and tea available 24 hours. Beer and Wine was available for a nominal charge when we checked in. We walked over to Olive Garden for dinner, parking lots are connected. there are several restaurants located near this hotel as well, Mall located across the street. I used the interned/business center located next to the front desk. This hotel is convienently located off of I95.

Reviews.Title: “The bed was the best...Rooms were average”
Reviews.Author: KendrasTravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in December 2011. Hotel is located right next to Daytona International Speedway and the airport. There is a free shuttle bus for up to two miles from hotel. They very nice eating area serving coffee and tea 24hrs. In the morning they have free waffels, oatmeal, cereal, fruit, eggs. I was really impressed. They kept everything refilled and clean. The best thing about our stay were the beds and the bed linens. Very comfortable!! We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: PuertoricanTraveler
Reviews.Content: The locations is indeed excellent! Near colleges( Embry-Riddle, Daytona State college), airport, , and raceway. Very comfortable but small rooms and good as usual hampton breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Convienent”
Reviews.Author: Slayridez06
Reviews.Content: Rooms were tight, but clean. Breakfast was good. Location was excellent for track access and plenty of restaurants close by.

Reviews.Title: “July 2011”
Reviews.Author: Izwatiz
Reviews.Content: Great location, only one side street across from track. Staff is very nice and accommodating. Rooms are somewhat small, but comfortable. Pool area is nice. Breakfast buffet is very good. Close to shopping and dining. Most convenient location to speedway.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mniet42
Reviews.Content: Not only did I get bit by bedbugs, I took them home!!!! Breakfast was bad, overcooked. The GM Joe was downright disgusting!! Never again at this run down cesspool of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “lousy hotel”
Reviews.Author: solivita512
Reviews.Content: stayed for weekend races 2 nights never got maid service called at night to get towels and got a snippy night manager hotel is run down hot water not hot breakfast is subpar for Hampton Inn they couldn't even give me a receipt for my bill on checkout(kept coming up blank)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rvr5000
Reviews.Content: I was a guest at this hotel a few weeks ago and it was without a doubt the best Hilton Property I have ever stayed at. The staff was great and the room was fabulous and quiet. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the Daytona area. I will be staying in Daytona in a few months and looking forward to coming back to this location.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Hampton Inns we have stayed in....”
Reviews.Author: ltalley44
Reviews.Content: We were visiting our daughter and stayed 4 nights at this hotel. We came in a day early and the front desk was very accommodating. The hotel was very clean and the beds were so comfortable we slept in every day. The continental breakfast was wonderful!! They had items not normally on the free buffet such as canandian bacon and english muffins topped with "real" eggs, melted cheese and bacon - delicious! The host made everyone feel very welcome and he was also the evening bartender in the lobby. The pool area had beautiful landscaping that made you really relax and even though this hotel is near the airport, we never heard the planes. The staff was very knowledgeable, friendly and professional - ALL of them! Great location and great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing to say the least”
Reviews.Author: SeekTheBest
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at plenty of Hampton Inns over the years, it's our usual "go to" hotel when we're just staying someplace a day or two. I don't expect 5 star, but I do expect the hotels to live up to the brand, even if they're a converted Days Inn, which many are. This hotel was hot and when I say hit, I mean they keep the air conditioning off in the hallways and the elevators to save a few dollars. It was horrible just getting from the lobby to our room. The rug down the hallway leading to our room had a big slice going through it. And the hotel smelled musty. These are things I'd expect to find at a Super 8 motel or some out of the way, no-name place. Definitely not at a Hampton Inn. I will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Check the sheets”
Reviews.Author: spyder1964
Reviews.Content: The only problem we had were the sheets had not been changed from the previous guest. Upon turning down the cover both beds had hair on the sheets. Contacted the front desk and they immediately came down and changed the sheets and gave us two free drink coupons which we did not use. The rooms were very quite and we had free internet. If we had not had a problem with the beds I would have rated this hotel very high. The staff was very responsive and apologetic about the bedding.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, relaxing environment, very clean and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: lhcvettegirl
Reviews.Content: LHC/BWC Brooksville, Fl. We were there for biketoberfest. The service could not have been any better. They provided transprotation to the speedway and to the local restaurants. Lots of people gathered in the lobby to watch the Florida Gators football game. It's a great place to kick back and enjoy your vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Staff”
Reviews.Author: SoxPrincess
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Daytona Hampton Inn last July (2008). I booked the Speedway hotel because my nephew is a huge NASCAR fan, and our main reason for visiting Daytona was to visit the Speedway. I originally booked a different speedway hotel, but switched to the Hampton Inn based on the comments concerning the staff that I read here – I was not disappointed. The entire staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. They were especially kind to a nine-year-old boy who “shared” every moment of his speedway experience with every person he encountered who worked at the hotel. I’ll always be grateful that to a person, they seemed interested in what he had to say. My seven-year-old even noticed how nice the staff was – she said “the nicest people are here” more than once. As there were no racing events going on when we were there – the hotel seemed to have more business travelers than tourists. The free breakfast was sparsely populated each morning (we didn’t go to breakfast until around 9), but there was still plenty of food – which they seemed to replenish through the morning. The hotel is on a main road – with many restaurants and stores close by. There was a mall across the road – we didn’t go there, but it seemed to have a good number of stores. We spent one day at the Speedway, and drove to the beach the other days. It was not a bad drive. The hotel gave us directions, and pointed out places to park near public rest rooms, food, etc. available. There were times I was sorry that we didn’t stay at a hotel on the beach and commute to the Speedway – but in truth, it wasn’t a bad drive to the beach, and the thrill my nephew got when he could see and drive by the Speedway everyday was well worth it. I can’t say enough good things about the staff - I would definitely stay here again if visiting Daytona.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay at perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: adetom
Reviews.Content: The Hampton Inn at Daytona is a great hotel in a great location, surrounded by a lot of stores and restaurants. And it's 1 block from Daytona Speedway. My husband and I just returned from a trip to Daytona for the Daytona 500. The hotel was completely sold out and very busy. Yet, every employee we encountered was not only nice and accommodating, they were exceptionally so. At first I thought that maybe Daytona was populated with nice, happy people until a friend who was staying at a Wyndham at Daytona Beach said her experience was the opposite; she encountered rudeness and indifference. I've come to the conclusion that being kind and gracious is a requirement for employment at the Hampton. The hotel provides a shuttle to/from not only the airport but to anywhere in a 2 mile radius. This came in very handy for us to do shopping and to pick up race credentials. Also they provided transportation to the racetrack which was a real perk. The room was spotless and very tastefully decorated. The bathroom was small but the layout was nice and it functioned very well. Both the room and the bathroom have design touches that I may even incorporate in my own home. Though we didn't use it, the work station in the room was efficiently laid out. Breakfast was provided and was good. It included fresh fruit, yogurt, cereal, assorted sweet rolls, muffins and bread. Additionally, there were two hot items that changed daily. We had a wonderful "happy hour" with drinks and snacks (hot and cold) that revolved around race times. This may be a special touch they include just for the Daytona 500; I'm not sure but it was good and it was appreciated. Overall this hotel was wonderful. Thank you Managers and Staff at Hampton Inn; we hope to see you again next year. P.S. A special thanks goes out to Anthony Segio, Director of Sales for his help.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!!!”
Reviews.Author: MC-JunoBeach
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect location to chose if you are planning to spend time at the Speedway or need to be close to the airport. Kyra the manager, and her staff do a wonderful job making sure all of their guests are well taken care of. I have stayed at quite a few other hotels/resorts in the Daytona area, but nothing compares to the Hampton. We have been coming to this hotel for years and it just seems to get better with every visit. Keep up the great work guys! Can't wait to see you all again! Sheri B.

Reviews.Title: “The Official Hotel of Team Seattle”
Reviews.Author: TeamSeattle4Ever
Reviews.Content: Hi Kyra!~ Yes its true...you can actually be on a first name basis with the management of a hotel! My race team, Team Seattle comes down to race in the Rolex 24 hours each year and this has been our hotel for the past 3 years and are returning with over 100 of our VIP guests in about a month. We have never had a problem with this Hampton! Everything is just perfect and the staff is so wonderful considering they are invaded by over 100 Seattlites each January. Breakfast is fabulous and everytime we walk into the lobby someone is always greeting us with a smile! I absolutely love visiting! -Kami-Team Seattle

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kburns
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here three years in row during bike week. Each year it has improved to the point that really enjoy staying there. The GM Kyra is friendly and helpful as is the entire staff. the entire facility is clean, great parking and in a good location. Close to everything but still peaceful. I'll return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: ftpjtm
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice. Rooms were clean, as was the common areas of the hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful. We were at the hotel during "Bike Week", which is one of the busiest periods for Daytona, and the hotel was fully booked. But this did not cause any problems, everything worked like clockwork. There was plenty of parking, lots of room at breakfast, the reservation was held for us properly, check in and out were fast and efficient, and the overall service at the hotel was great. As mentioned above the hotel was very clean, although it was not brand-new. Seems to be well run, and kept up very well. Can't think of any negatives!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfy and inviting”
Reviews.Author: borntotravel999
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 435 for two days after Christmas. The new beds and bedding were WONDERFUL. It was like sleeping on clouds. The hotel was very clean and the continental breakfast was very nice. Hotel staff very friendly and accomodating. The only problem I had was that in the far left corner there was mold extending about three feet from the corner. I didn't mention it until I checked out (just wanted to crash) and the desk clerk was apologetic and thanked me for letting her know. She wrote it down, so I'm assuming it will be taken care of. If I need a hotel off the beach again, I will definately stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: whatfun
Reviews.Content: Really appreciated the hospitality at this property. The place is very clean, the staff very helpful, and breakfast was great every day. Although we were only in the area for a couple of days to attend a family graduation, we found our stay very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hospitality”
Reviews.Author: brn2race
Reviews.Content: Very enjoyable stay. The room was as stated by reservations. The staff was friendly and helpful during a very busy seasonal time. It seems people only write complaints and I just wanted to let everyone know what a great place this is to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Business”
Reviews.Author: Racer6
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay. Was there on business. Staff very professional, effecient and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Gillsville
Reviews.Content: This property was an excellent choice for our needs. It was close to the airport and beaches. The room was clean and decorated nicely. We had no problems with the management, and the GM, Kyra Woodward, bent over backwards to meet our requests and/or answer any questions about what to see/do while in the Daytona area. We would recommend this property to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: GERIZ
Reviews.Content: This is the place to be! Great location! Close to everything. Will absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: not clean. small room. smells musty

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't recomend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very small rooms, the ice machine on our floor did not work. You have to drive to go anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, we loved it there!”
Reviews.Author: smartgirl247
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, clean rooms, friendly staff, lots of parking space. We were overall satisfied and would definitely stay there again. Its a 15 minutes drive to the beaches, so no problem.
